RESOURCE.STRING: Turbocharger Actuator Test

The Turbocharger Actuator test is used to help isolate and troubleshoot variable geometry turbocharger problems by allowing the user to command the turbocharger actuator to its retracted and extended positions. The vehicle air system must be fully charged to perform this test properly.
Select Start to start the test.
Starting test, please wait
To operate the turbocharger actuator specify a delay time, then select the desired actuator command to Extend or Retract the actuator. To stop the test select Stop.

The Turbocharger Actuator test is used to help isolate and troubleshoot variable geometry turbocharger problems by allowing the user to command the turbocharger to its retracted and extended positions. The vehicle air system must be fully charged to perform this test properly.

The turbocharger actuator is currently opened. To close the actuator, specify a delay in the Delay section, then click Close Actuator. To stop the test, click Stop.

Select desired position
To operate the turbocharger actuator specify a delay time, then select the desired actuator command to Close or Open the actuator. To stop the test, select Stop.

The EGR Valve Test allows the operator to move the EGR Valve when the engine is not running and the vehicle is not moving. The actuator contains a lightweight return spring. This may or may not cause the EGR valve to return to the open position when the EGR motor is turned off. A high pitched frequency noise can normally be heard when the EGR Valve motor is on.
